newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Ssangyong denies capital injection by Mercedes Benz.
newsitem.headline: Ssangyong denies capital injection by Mercedes Benz.

text.p: South Korea's Ssangyong Group denied on Thursday a newspaper report that its German partner, Mercedes Benz, had agreed to inject 160 billion won into the ailing Ssangyong Motor.
"The report is not true. But we are a negotiating capital increase with Benz," said a Ssangyong Group spokesman.
The German partner, a unit of Daimler-Benz AG, owns a 2.55 percent stake of Ssangyong Motor.
The domestic Chosun Ilbo newspaper said Ssangyong and Benz had tentatively agreed on the capital injection as the German partner expected high marketablity of Ssangyong's new model sedan "Chairman".
Ssangyong Motor has suffered from huge losses, a result of massive investments in new models.
Ssangyong's debts are currently estimated at 3.2 trillion won. The nation's four-wheel-drive utility vehicle maker incurred losses of 228.5 billion won in 1996 on sales of 1.37 trillion won in 1995.
